p: Vitamin D treatment has been recommended on a background of COVID-19 by clinicians [ 135]. Considering the potential benefits of enhanced immunity, mitigation of the inflammatory response, epidemiological data on protection from severe infection and established safety, it is reasonable to consider vitamin D replacement in patients with demonstrable deficiency. Limited exposure to sunlight, and poor dietary conditions as a result of the lockdown in most countries, are important factors that would increase the need of vitamin D supplementation.
